Keywords: Avengers , Defenders , Scientist
Real Name: Bruce Banner
Special Powers
MOVEMENT: Destroy Blocking
GAMMA CLAP: Once per range attack, when Hulk or an adjacent friendly character would be hit, you may roll 2d6. If you do and your roll is equal to or greater than the attacker's finalized attack roll, the attack automatically misses all targets and after resolutions deal 1 penetrating damage to the attacker. Protected: Pulse Wave.
HULK ANGRY!: STOP. Regeneration. Impervious, but succeeds on 4-6 and can reduce penetrating damage. // Hulk has SAFEGUARD: Outwit.
NO HURT HULK FRIEND!: Battle Fury, Close Combat Expert.

Comments
November 12, 2022
Xavolice
I completely agree with Oathful. I prefer more thematically accurate dials over cheap hyper-efficient figures that the meta demands. I personally still use AAOU Hulk in big games even though he took a massive hit from the nerf hammer after updated Outwit and Regen rules, but this guy looks like a nice alternative for a beefy hulk. Let's be honest, hulk isn't always the best teammate, he often falls into the one man army category, even if it is less competitive in this game.
October 25, 2022
Slade Wilson
Gotta agree with Oathful. We've had some good low-cost Hulks as of late. It's nice to see one this beefy! Wish he was about 25 points less though. Strange.
October 25, 2022
pokolo
This is a fun looking Hulk don’t get me wrong, but I would have liked a team friendly lower starting line on this. Click 8 would have been perfect for a 50-75 point line. Still keep the 200 point line, just give us a second lower point line.
October 24, 2022
Oathful
I don't know why, but this feels like a breath of fresh air. Finally, a Bruce Banner Hulk that isn't a 5 click push-over or a weird Wolverine/Horsemen wannabe. Immortal Hulk was the closest we got to this kind of dial in years, and even he (as powerful and fun as he is) just didn't capture the Hulk feel for me. Big numbers, STOP clicks, Giant Size, and they even represented his clap. I don't even care that he doesn't have a lower cost for competitive team building, this Hulk is going in my collection since I haven't had a good, modern Hulked-out Bruce for big games since the Age of Ultron movie (not counting Infinity's Colossal Hulk). // Thematic: 9.5/10, Viability: 7/10, Fun Factor: 10/10 (probably a little biased), leans towards home-fun.
